item.title: My Data Science Journey
item.description: My freshmen year at UT Austin I was unsure in the career I wanted to pursue. I started as a Public Health major and was on the Pre-Med track. It was the only career track I had interest at the time. It was until I became involved in the Freshmen Research Initiative program that made me realize what I wanted to pursue. Spring 2019 I was in the Big Data in Biology cohort and became exposed to Python and RNA-seq data analysis.

item.title: Project 1: Exploratory Data Analysis
item.description: Data Wrangling and Data Exploration Broadway Data Analysis Project by: Ericka Salas (efs554) Introduction of Broadway Data Before the COVID-19 pandemic hit, I worked at a box office on UT Austin's campus that mainly sold tickets to concerts and broadway performances. I became a huge broadway fan and for the past two years of working in the office, attending broadway musicals has always been fun and exciting. I miss the feeling of the lights dimming at the beginning of a show or intermission conversations on the songs I enjoyed the most.

item.title: Project 2: Modeling, Testing, and Predicting
item.description: Modeling, Testing, and Predicting Analysis of Attitude Towards Science Survey Project by: Ericka Salas (efs554) Introducing Dataset - Science Study! Growing up I loved science and I continue to do so. Though, how do other people feel about science based on different factors? The dataset that I am analyzing is a school science survey dataset that is based on the attitudes to science based on sex, private or public school, and class in two different Australian states.

item.title: Projects
item.description: Check out some of my coding projects below: Wrangling & Exploratory Data Analysis Modeling, Inference, Prediction --
